elements.title: Eva Olsson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after men took all the 2021 Nobel Prizes for science, one of the selectors, Eva Olsson (pictured), said "we want to have more women nominated"?

elements.title: woman of the Chatti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the woman of the Chatti was allegedly a Germanic prophetess whose advice inspired Roman Emperor Vitellius to murder his own mother, Sextilia?

elements.title: Yen Hoang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in October 2021, American wheelchair racer Yen Hoang came in the top three in marathons on consecutive days?

elements.title: opened in Zanzibar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first East German embassy in Africa opened in Zanzibar in 1964?

elements.title: American Computer and Peripheral (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American Computer and Peripheral was the first company to offer a plug-in board for Intel's 386 processor?

elements.title: advocate general (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that thanks to the advocate general's opinion, one is likely to know the outcome of a court case before the European Court of Justice before it even starts drafting the ruling?

elements.title: Starship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that SpaceX's reusable Starship launch vehicle has twice as much thrust as the Apollo program's Saturn V?

elements.title: Above Znoneofthe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Canadian politician Above Znoneofthe chose his name so as to be placed last on alphabetical ballots?
